image.altText: Bradley John Murdoch

props.synopsis: Conspiracy theories about the murder of Peter Falconio dogged his family and girlfriend Joanne Lees for as long as Bradley Murdoch denied his guilt. So where does the truth lie?

title.children: Was Bradley Murdoch guilty? Court transcripts and experts reveal the truth

image.altText: View of mountains in a golden yellow colour, hazy sky in the horizon.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Parks is reminding hikers to carry personal location devices and be well prepared when they head into the outback.

title.children: Larapinta Trail hikers urged caution after two rescues in one week

image.altText: A wide shot of a strip of shops with cars parked in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Joseph Wunungmurra, 39, has been sentenced for his role in a fatal assault on a man outside the Rapid Creek shopping centre in 2023.

title.children: Man jailed for six years for fatal assault outside Darwin shopping centre

image.altText: An Aboriginal women accepts a medal from the Governor-General, with an image of Yunupingu displayed prominently behind her.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's most influential Aboriginal leaders has posthumously received the nation's highest civilian honour.

title.children: Dr Yunupiŋu posthumously awarded Australia's highest civilian honour

image.altText: The bonnent of an NT police car that reads "police" and has the NT police force emblem. Green leaves blurred in right corner.

props.synopsis: Police have charged the 34-year-old man with sexual intercourse with a child under 10, over an incident at a Ludmilla home last month.

title.children: Man charged with rape of child under 10 in Darwin's northern suburbs

image.altText: An Aboriginal child in a black adidas shirt holding an Aboriginal toddler in a white and balck shirt, on a basketball court

props.synopsis: The Kumanjayi Walker Inquest backs Aboriginal-led solutions and restoring Warlpiri self-determination, which his family says will "prevent deaths in custody".

title.children: Police shooting of Kumanjayi Walker could lead to NT communities taking back full control

image.altText: Donald Trump speaking to the media in the White House Press Room.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump undergoes a medical exam after noticing his legs swelling.

title.children: Donald Trump diagnosed with vein condition that causes leg swelling

image.altText: A man looks at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Australia's broader All Ordinaries index is closing in on the 9,000-point mark, as the benchmark ASX 200 also sets fresh records. Follow live.

title.children: All Ords nears 9,000 points as ASX follows Wall St to record highs

props.synopsis: One of Australia's most influential Aboriginal leaders has posthumously received the nation's highest civilian honour.

title.children: Dr Yunupiŋu posthumously awarded Australia's highest civilian honour

image.altText: Albanese looks serious, behind him is a dark background

props.synopsis: The first sitting weeks of the 48th parliament will see MPs of all persuasions adjusting to the new status quo — and avoiding political pitfalls.

title.children: New parliament presents traps for Albanese and Ley

image.altText: A pile of bright coloured ants pile together to create a raft on water. the photo is so close you can see a reflection

props.synopsis: As fire ants continue their relentless march across south-east Queensland, a biological control expert from the United States warns "one or two selfish individuals" could destroy Australia's eradication plan.

title.children: Fears a few 'selfish individuals' could lose Australia's fire ant war

image.altText: Salim Mehajer getting into a car

props.synopsis: Disgraced businessman Mehajer walked free on parole from a Sydney jail on Friday, ending a long and controversial chapter with the law.

title.children: First stop Westfield: Salim Mehajer released from jail

image.altText: parts of guns

props.synopsis: It's alleged the man sent the individual firearm parts to various addresses in Australia.

title.children: Police stop alleged black market plot to import hundreds of 'deadly' guns into Australia

image.altText: Priest Gabriele Romanello was injured in the strike.

props.synopsis: Pope Leo XIV has renewed his call for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza in response to the attack.

title.children: Israeli strike on Gaza Catholic church injures priest close to Pope Francis

image.altText: Two women with shoulder-length hair smile at the camera, with one wearing a black-and-white backpack

props.synopsis: The move would allow 16-year-olds to vote at the next UK national election and would be the biggest change to the country's electorate in more than half a century.

title.children: UK to allow 16-year-olds to vote in biggest electoral change since 1969

image.altText: a woman scowling in front of an airport fence

props.synopsis: Passengers abandoned mid-flight in the outback highlight that Australian flyers have few rights.

title.children: Qantas apologises to customers abandoned mid-journey in a small outback town

image.altText: pilot Felix Baumgartner

props.synopsis: Famed for a record-breaking 2012 skydive from the edge of space, the 56-year-old dies after losing control of his paraglider and falling to the ground.

title.children: Extreme skydiver Felix Baumgartner dies in paragliding accident in Italy

image.altText: Jim Chalmers, wearing a thoughtful expression, stands in front of a dark background.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers is playing down concerns about a recent uptick in the unemployment rate, describing the figures as unwelcome but unsurprising.

title.children: Uptick in unemployment is 'unwelcome but unsurprising': Chalmers — as it happened

image.altText: Two men at press conferences wear suits and stand outside.

props.synopsis: With the fourth election in seven years almost upon Tasmania, one thing is certain — more is needed from politicians to ensure good government is the norm, not the exception.

title.children: Tasmanians weren't ready for this election — neither were their politicians

image.altText: Five men standing next two each other in a row and looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: The 98-year-old ran a camp for youth for two decades in Far North Queensland. He now stands accused of repeatedly sexually assaulting and having sex with a minor in the 70s.

title.children: Youth camp founder Geoffrey Guest on trial for child sexual assault

image.altText: GettyImages-2222701381

props.synopsis: St Kilda coach Ross Lyon hits out at racist online trolls as the Saints prepare to face the Cats at Kardinia Park.

title.children: 'It was hate, it was vehement': Saints coach hits out at racist trolls

image.altText: Three swimmers stand together after their race, with the Australian swimmer in the middle.

props.synopsis: Moesha Johnson earned her second gold medal of the World Aquatics Championships, underlining her status as the number one open-water swimmer on the planet with a victory in the 5km.

title.children: Moesha Johnson wins back-to-back world titles after thrilling sprint

image.altText: Ruth Chepngetich raises her arms

props.synopsis: Kenya's Ruth Chepngetich, who became the first woman to run under 2:10 for a marathon in Chicago last year, is provisionally suspended after failing a doping test.

title.children: Women's marathon world record holder suspended

image.altText: Microscope image showing tiny red and green specks of genetically modified bacteria against larger blue mammalian cells.

props.synopsis: Researchers tested a genetically engineered gut bacterium to try to limit kidney stones. But once inside some human volunteers, the modified microbe did not follow the plan.

title.children: Study leaves two people with genetically modified gut bacteria

image.altText: Mark Zuckerberg, standing on a stage, wearing a black t-shirt, talking at a company conference.

props.synopsis: Mark Zuckerberg and Meta shareholders agree to settle an $US8 billion lawsuit over claims stemming from the privacy scandal involving the Cambridge Analytica political consulting firm.

title.children: Meta investors settle $8b lawsuit with Zuckerberg over Facebook privacy

image.altText: Dmitry Medvedev sitting at a conference table with a neutral expression.

props.synopsis: Dmitry Medvedev says Russia needs to be ready to respond, potentially with pre-emptive strikes, if the West escalated its involvement in the Ukraine war.

title.children: Russia must be willing to strike West, country's former president says

image.altText: A woman in a purple jacket with large silver buttons sitting in an office chair.

props.synopsis: The director of Queensland's peak forensic science testing facility has resigned one month after being suspended as a result of "contamination issues" being identified.

title.children: Forensic science director quits after suspension

image.altText: A medium shot of a black bird in flight

props.synopsis: A proposed goldmine in WA will bring with it hundreds of jobs, but conservation groups are concerned about the impact it will have on the endangered Carnaby's black cockatoo population.

title.children: Concerns about goldmine impact on Carnaby's black cockatoo population

image.altText: Beyonce tips a black cowboy hat, wears shiny black long white blonde hair, nails long, background blurred.

props.synopsis: From a theft of unreleased Beyonce music to Albanese's Asian tour, it's been a big week in news. Test your knowledge.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A diplomatic visit, stolen music and a stage alight

image.altText: A laughing woman side by side with a man with white hair and beard pulling a funny face

props.synopsis: A lone tracker continues his search for Barry Podmore, missing in the same reserve where backpacker Carolina Wilga was found a week ago.

title.children: Man's family desperate for answers after backpacker's miracle survival

image.altText: Garbage 2025

props.synopsis: As alternative rockers Garbage release their eighth album, Let All That We Imagine Be the Light, frontwoman Shirley Hanson talks about embracing optimism at a dark time.

title.children: Garbage's Shirley Manson pulled herself out of the abyss to write new album

image.altText: Illustration shows a power board with Mlaaysia's city skyline emerging out of it in blues and purples.

props.synopsis: Malaysia is hoping to become a regional leader in the digital economy, but environmental, resource and geopolitical challenges loom.

title.children: How this small nation has caught the attention of the tech giants

image.altText: Cameron Smith looks at a putt

props.synopsis: Cameron Smith smacked one of the worst tee shots of his major career, which turned into a fitting launch of an underwhelming day for Australia's Open Championship contingent.

title.children: Aussie Open crew playing catch-up after Smith shocker

image.altText: A swift parrot perching on a branch

props.synopsis: A gathering of close to the total estimated population of swift parrots excites ecologists, but they warn it is no party for the critically endangered species.

title.children: Massive flock of critically endangered swift parrots seen in one spot
